l: CloudSolute your OCR video browser. Search over milions of videos for any kind of string or words
p: Welcome to the next generation of video browsing, where you can search for any word or string of characters across millions of videos. Not only can you search on multiple platforms such as YouTube, Twitch, and Dailymotion, but you can also upload, rewatch, and search through your personal videos in your own dedicated space.

l: Search for any string written in milions of videos using OCR
p: Search through our vast database of videos with just a keyboard, and let our search engine, find the right videos where this word appears WRITTEN in the screen, showing you the videos and the seconds where this word appears.
Start searching by entering a keyword. Quickly find the videos you need, from tutorials to specific topics, with our fast and accurate search.
Find a selection of videos matching your keyword quickly. Easily preview and choose the best ones for your needs right on our platform.
Start searching by entering a keyword. Quickly find the videos you need, from tutorials to specific topics, with our fast and accurate search.
Use our frame-by-frame feature for detailed editing. Easily find and adjust specific frames to get the perfect video timing and cut.

l: Search for a string in all elk, and returns the vid:id of the videos where the string appears, and paginates the results by 10 by default

p: comments (object): An object containing the minimum and maximum number of comments for the videos.
duration (object): An object containing the minimum and maximum duration of the videos (in seconds).
Mandatory:
max (integer): The maximum duration of the videos.
max (integer): The maximum number of comments.
max (integer): The maximum number of views.
min (integer): The minimum duration of the videos.
min (integer): The minimum number of comments.
min (integer): The minimum number of views.
offset_page (string): The page number for pagination.
Optionals:
page_size (integer): The number of results to be displayed per page.
platform (string): The platform on which the videos are hosted.
search_string (string): The keyword for the search.
tags (string): The tags associated with the videos.
title (string): The title of the videos to be searched._ channel_name (string): The name of the channel to be searched.
user_token (string): The user token for authentication.
video_id (string): The unique IDs of the videos to be searched.
views (object): An object containing the minimum and maximum number of views for the videos.

l: Function to Retrieve All Videos from a Company
p: Bad Request (400):
Description: This API retrieves all videos associated with a company using the authentication mechanism.
Endpoint: https://siv.cloudsolute.net/api/get-all-videos-from-company
Ensure that you have the necessary permissions to access this API.
Example Request:
Internal Server Error (500):
Invalid Token (401):
Method: POST
No Results Found (404):
Notes:
offset_page(integer, optional): The page number to retrieve. Default is 0.
page_size(integer, optional): The number of results to return per page. Default is 100.
Parameters:
Request Body:
Response:
Success (200):
The response includes a list of video IDs and their associated platforms.
The user_token must be valid and associated with a user who has access to the company's videos.
user_token(string, required): The user token for authentication.

l: Freemium API to Search a Word Over the Entire Video Database
p: API Error (500):
Description: This API allows you to search for a specific word across the entire video database. It returns a list of video IDs where the word is found.
Endpoint: https://siv.cloudsolute.net/api/string-in-all-b2b
Ensure that you have the necessary permissions to access this API.
Example Usage:
Method: POST
No Results Found (404):
Notes:
offset_page(integer, optional): The page number to retrieve. Default is 0.
page_size(integer, optional): The number of results to return per page. Default is 10.
Parameters:
Request Body:
Response:
search_string(string, required): The word or phrase to search for in the video database.
Success (200):
The page_size and offset_page parameters can be used to paginate through large result sets.
The search_string parameter is case-sensitive.

l: API to Search for Frame Numbers with a Specific String in a Given Video
p: API Error (500):{"message": "Backend request error on business function: search_string_on_vidid_get_framenumbers name 's' is not defined","result": [],"status": 500}

Description: This API is linked to string-in-all-b2b and will be called once string-in-all-b2b has been called. It searches for frame numbers with a specific string in a given video and paginates the results.
Endpoint: https://siv.cloudsolute.net/api/string-in-all-paginate-framenumbers-b2b
Ensure that you have the necessary permissions to access this API.
Example Usage: curl -X POST https://siv.cloudsolute.net/api/string-in-all-paginate-framenumbers-b2b-H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"video_id": "vid-XcljQpU6dc4","search_string": "import"}'
Method: POST
No Results Found (404):{"message": "No results found","result": [],"status": 404}
Notes:
Parameters:
Request Body:{"video_id": "vid-XcljQpU6dc4","search_string": "import"}
Response:
search_string(string, required): The word or phrase to search for in the video.
Success (200):{"message": "Results found","result": [{"data": [{"frame_num": 1}]}],"status": 200}
The search_string parameter is case-sensitive.
This API should be called after string-in-all to paginate through the results.
video_id(string, required): The ID of the video in which to search for the string.
Bad Request (400):
Description: This API is used to delete videos from the server. It requires the video ID and the user ID to verify access rights before deleting the video.
Endpoint: https://siv.cloudsolute.net/api/um-delete-video
Ensure that you have the necessary permissions to access this API.
Example Request:
Internal Server Error (500):
Invalid Token (401):
Method: POST
Not Having Access to Delete the Video (403):
Notes:
Parameters:
Request Body:
Response:
Success (200):
The user_id must be valid and associated with a user who has access to delete the video.
The video_id must be a valid video ID associated with the user.
user_id(string, required): The ID of the user requesting the deletion.
Video Not Found (404):
video_id(string, required): The ID of the video to be deleted.

l: Function to Get the HLS Playlist
p: Description: This API retrieves the HLS playlist for a specified video.
Endpoint: https://siv.cloudsolute.net/api/um-get-hls-playlist/{video_id}
Ensure that you have the necessary permissions to access this API.
Example Usage:
Internal Server Error (500):
Invalid Token (401):
Method: POST
Not Owning the Video (403):
Notes:
Parameters:
Request Body:
Response:
Success (200):
The HLS playlist is returned in the standard M3U8 format.
The user_token must be valid and associated with a user who has access to the specified video.
user_token(string, required): The user token for authentication.
video_id(string, required): The ID of the video for which to retrieve the HLS playlist.

l: Function to Get the HLS Segment
p: Content-Type: application/octet-stream
Description: The response body contains the binary data of the requested HLS segment.
Description: This API retrieves a specific HLS segment for a specified video.
Endpoint: https://siv.cloudsolute.net/api/um-get-hls-segment/{video_id}/{segment}
Ensure that you have the necessary permissions to access this API.

Example Usage: curl -X POST https://siv.cloudsolute.net/api/um-get-hls-segment/vid-Oh04G9dm5B179LUeR5eBXsViBnufr1nccBREFj77K0/1-H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"user_token": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.78_vQ1O74ZExEBPedRmWeMLU3UFEe86F_HGv7qQIbaY"}'
Internal Server Error (500):
Invalid Token (401):
Method: POST
Not Owning the Video (403):
Notes:
Parameters:
Request Body:
Response:
Segment Not Found (404):
segment(integer, required): The segment number to retrieve.
Success (200):
The response will be binary data representing the HLS segment. Make sure to handle it appropriately in your application.
The user_token must be valid and associated with a user who has access to the specified video.
user_token(string, required): The user token for authentication.
video_id(string, required): The ID of the video from which to retrieve the HLS segment.
Description: This API uploads a video file to the server. It auto-generates a unique video ID, uploads the video to the bucket, inserts the video data into the database, and returns the video ID.
Endpoint: https://siv.cloudsolute.net/api/um-upload-video
Ensure that you have the necessary permissions to access this API.
Example Request:
Form Data:
Invalid Token (401):
Method: POST
Not Having Access to Upload to the Company (403):
Notes:
Request Body:
Response:
Success (200):
The response includes details about the uploaded video, such as the unique video ID, size, extension, and estimated processing time.
The user_id must be valid and associated with a user who has access to upload videos.
The video_file must be a valid video file.
user_id(string, required): The ID of the user uploading the video.
video_file(file, required): The video file to be uploaded.

l: B2B Company Documentation: Using Our APIs
p: Welcome to the documentation for B2B companies looking to use our APIs. Below are the detailed steps to set up and use our APIs effectively.
Create a Company on Cloudsolute
Obtain OAuth Key from Google Cloud Console
Create a Google Login Button
Use Login and Verify APIs
Use the Token to Make API Calls
Go to Company Creation Page:
Visit b2b.cloudsolute.net/crear-company
Log In:
Log in with your user account.
Create Company:
Fill out the form with your company details.
Submit the form to create the company.
Wait for Approval:
Wait for your company to be approved by our team. You will receive a notification once the process is complete.

l: Obtain OAuth Key from Google Cloud Console
p: Access Google Cloud Console:
Click on "Create Credentials" and select "OAuth Client ID".
Click on "New Project".
Click on the project dropdown menu at the top of the page.
Configure OAuth Consent Screen:
Configure the application type and add authorized redirect URIs.
Configure the consent screen with the required information.
Create a New Project:
Create OAuth Credentials:
Download the JSON file with the credentials.
Enable Necessary APIs:
Go to Google Cloud Console.
In the navigation menu, select "APIs & Services" > "Credentials".
In the navigation menu, select "APIs & Services" > "Library".
In the navigation menu, select "APIs & Services" > "OAuth consent screen".
Log in with your Google account.
Log In:
Name your project and click "Create".
Search for and enable the APIs you need, such as "Google Drive API" or "Google Sheets API".
Implement the Login Button:
Use the obtained OAuth credentials to implement a Google login button on your webpage.
Ensure the button redirects users to the Google authentication flow.
Function to handle first-time user login:
Endpoint: /api/user-login
Method: POST
Request Body:
Function to verify the token:
Endpoint: /api/verify-token
Method: POST
Request Body:
Note: With the Google token, you must first call /api/user-login and then /api/verify-token so that Cloudsolute can validate and modify the Google token, adding more data.

l: Use the Token to Make API Calls
p: Once you have obtained the final token from Cloudsolute, you can use it to make various API calls. Below are some example endpoints:
Search String in All Videos:
/api/string-in-all-b2b
B2B Company Documentation: Using Our APIs
Search String in All Videos with Pagination:
/api/string-in-all-paginate-framenumbers-b2b
Get HLS Playlist:
/api/um-get-hls-playlist/vid-Oh04G9dm5B179LUeR5eBXsViBnufr1nccBREFj77K0
B2B Company Documentation: Using Our APIs
Get HLS Segment:
/api/um-get-hls-segment/vid-Oh04G9dm5B179LUeR5eBXsViBnufr1nccBREFj77K0/10
Upload Video:
/api/um-upload-video
B2B Company Documentation: Using Our APIs
Delete Video:
/api/um-delete-video
Get All Videos from Company:
/api/get-all-videos-from-company
B2B Company Documentation: Using Our APIs
Thank you for using our APIs! If you have any questions or need further information, please feel free to contact us.`

l: Search a word in a video and get the frames

This api can be used alongside /api/string-in-all or /api/advanced-search to get the frames where the word appears in the video. It will return the time in seconds where the word appears in the video.

p: Mandatory:
platform (text, required): The platform on which the search operation needs to be performed.
search_string (text, required): The string to be searched.
video_id (text, required): The video id of the video to be searched.
Working on it
Linkedin
CloudSolute

We want to share a fundamental feature of our platform: the generation of unique identifiers for uploaded files. This feature uses a hash algorithm linked to the file and base64 to create compact IDs, ensuring uniqueness even if the file is deleted and re-uploaded. Additionally, it helps prevent file duplication by detecting if they already exist in our system.
Our first MPV its related to achieve the initial state of an eLearning site on which we will have the following features:
A free to use basic OCR search engine on which you will be able to search for as many words you want on our database of videos.
A Premium OCR advanced search on which you will be able to search for any word on our database of videos by using filters and advanced search options.
A starter lists feature on which you will be able to create lists of videos and make seach over them.
10/06/2024 - Basic Search working. You can search for any string written in milions of videos using OCR
20/06/2024 - New stylish for the page. Including dar mode.
23/06/2024 - We have a google login working
11/07/2024 - Now you can create your lists and add videos to them. Search over the list not available yet.

Optical Character Recognition (OCR) is a technology that enables the conversion of various types of documents, such as scanned images of printed text, PDF files, or photographs of text, into digital data that can be electronically edited and searched.
The OCR process begins with acquiring the image that contains the text. This image can be obtained through a scanner, digital camera, or any other image-capturing device.

Before the text in the image can be recognized, the image typically undergoes preprocessing to enhance its quality and facilitate recognition. This step may include noise removal, contrast adjustment, skew correction, and binarization (converting the image to black and white).

The preprocessed image is segmented into different parts: lines of text, words, and finally, individual characters. This step is crucial for the OCR software to identify and process each character separately.

In this stage, the OCR software uses algorithms to compare each segment of the image (character) with a database of known patterns. Recognition methods may include neural networks, machine learning, and other advanced algorithms. Each identified character is converted to its digital equivalent.

After the characters have been recognized, the software can apply additional corrections to improve accuracy, such as using word dictionaries to correct typographical errors. The text can also be formatted to resemble the original.
OCR technology is used in a wide range of applications:
Document Digitization: Converts physical documents into editable digital files, making them easier to store, search, and edit.
Data Automation: Extracts information from forms, invoices, and other documents for automatic integration into databases.
Text Recognition in Images: Enables the search and extraction of text in photographs, such as signs, advertisements, and posters.
Reading for Visually Impaired Individuals: Helps convert printed text into audio or braille.
Content Analysis: Facilitates the analysis of large volumes of text in historical documents, books, and other materials.
Efficiency: Significantly reduces the time and effort required to manually transcribe printed texts into digital formats.
Accessibility: Makes information contained in physical documents accessible and usable in digital formats.
Cost Savings: Saves costs associated with physical storage and document management.
Accuracy: Advances in recognition algorithms have increased the accuracy of OCR, approaching human-level precision in text transcription.
Image Quality: Low-quality images, blurry text, or poorly scanned documents can reduce OCR accuracy.
Diversity of Fonts and Styles: The variety of fonts and writing styles can make accurate character recognition challenging.
Languages and Symbols: OCR technology may struggle with languages that have complex characters, multiple dialects, or special symbols.

OCR technology is a powerful tool for text digitization and automation, with applications ranging from document management to accessibility and data analysis. As the technology advances, its accuracy and ability to handle a broader diversity of texts and contexts continue to improve.
